We also have housing, benefits and debt advice available on site during the Thursday session.

At times, seasonal veg and food is available to purchase.There is also a "Rhu-Baby" shop selling essential items for babies and children available to browse through and purchase for a small donation. Cost: Hot drinks and food available at a small cost from just £1.

hours._text: Brimington Community Centre, Heywood Street, Brimington, Chesterfield, S43 1DB (main door on High Street) Thursdays 2pm to 6.30pm Warm Hub - free cuppa and biscuit, warm space to have a chat or read the paper. Brimington Lunch Club - Tuesdays 12pm (noon). Two course home-cooked lunch with hot drink at a small charge of £4 (under 12's £2); followed by a game of bingo.

Hollingwood Community Room, ‘Open House’, Laburnam St, Chesterfield, S40 4ST Mondays, 11am to 3pm. Open to all, warm friendly environment. Serving complimentary hot drinks, biscuits and cake. Richard Coles 07814557379

Inkersall Methodist Church (portacabin), Summerskill Green, Inkersall, Chesterfield, S43 3SR Tuesdays 9am to 1pm A free warm space / coffee morning offering hot drinks, biscuits and toasted teacakes. Jean Metcalfe 01246 476997 Minister Rev. Tracey Harris tracey.harris@methodist.org.uk

Staveley Edge Centre, Staveley Methodist Church, Chesterfield Road, S43 3XD Tuesday afternoon bingo Thursday afternoon free café (includes debt/housing/benefits advice), Fortnightly communion meal on a Thursday evening Monthly autism support group All opening times will include free tea / coffee, phone charging and biscuits. Tuesday 1.30 to 3pm Thursday 12.30 to 3.30pm Thursday fortnightly 6pm to 7.30pm Edge Ministries Steve Martin steve.martin@edgeministries.net

St Michael’s & All Angels Church Church Street Chesterfield S43 1JG 9am to 11am - Little Mick’s toddler group in church. 10am to 12pm - Bookshop and coffee morning church hall 2pm to 4pm - Safe space in church 9.30am - Holy communion service followed by coffee (even if people just want to come and sit in the heated building they’ll be welcome!) 2pm to 3pm - Ladies group in church hall (predominant aimed at post retirement age women) 10am to 12pm - Bookshop and cafe in church hall. Foodbank support and CAB help available. Rev Daniel Cooke 01246 273103 Email danielbcooke@hotmail.com
The Hop Flower Beeley Close Inkersall S43 3EB Warm space, free hot drink and biscuits. Monday to Friday, 4pm until late. Saturday and Sunday, 12pm until late. 01246 477733
St Columbus Church Inkersall Green Road Inkersall Staveley S43 3SE Wednesdays 10am to 2pm Warm space, free hot drink and biscuit. Adrian Arnold 01246 280633
